snippet: The election of far-right mayors is part of the party’s ambitious plan to build support from the ground up.
abstract: France's far-right National Front party has successfully installed candidates in mayoral offices across country; tactic is part of plan to build support, prove it can govern and set stage for 2017 presidential run by leader Marine Le Pen; mayors have been quick to impose party's anti-immigrant, nationalistic, populist ideology, stirring controversy and demonstrating reach at time when mainstream parties are faltering.

byline.contributor: Yann Cres contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The election of far-right mayors is part of the party’s ambitious plan to build support from the ground up.

headline.main: Seeking New Heights in France, National Front Party Thinks Locally
headline.print_headline: Seeking New Heights in France, National Front Thinks Locally
